narrative.title: 1St Greek Brigade - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Brigade (Free Greek Forces) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Free Greek infantry brigade integrated into British 8th Army for final Tunisia Campaign operations. Brigade participated in Battle of Enfidaville (19-21 April 1943), the final major 8th Army offensive in North Africa, and subsequent operations through Axis surrender (13 May 1943). Transitioned to occupation and security duties post-victory. Combat-proven formation with nearly 7 months continuous operations (El Alamein through Tunisia). High morale maintained despite mounting casualties and absence of replacement pipeline. Allied victory in North Africa celebrated as major milestone toward Greek homeland liberation.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Tunisian coastal hills, wadis, and cultivated plains - Enfidaville sector mountainous and challenging

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combat-proven veteran formation - El Alamein through Tunisia Campaign
Exceptional morale - victory in North Africa seen as step toward Greek liberation
British-trained and equipped to Commonwealth standards
Experience in diverse terrain - desert, coastal, hills, wadis
Strong unit cohesion despite attrition and no replacements
Proven in defensive and offensive operations

environment.terrain_type: Tunisian coastal hills, wadis, and cultivated plains - Enfidaville sector mountainous and challenging
